metadata.title: CVE-2017-16944 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
The receive_msg function in receive.c in the SMTP daemon in Exim 4.88 and4.89 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (infinite loopand stack exhaustion) via vectors involving BDAT commands and an impropercheck for a '.' character signifying the end of the content, related to thebdat_getc function.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-16944` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

exim4 - 4.82-3ubuntu2.3
exim4-base - 4.82-3ubuntu2.3
exim4-config - 4.82-3ubuntu2.3
exim4-daemon-heavy - 4.82-3ubuntu2.3
exim4-daemon-light - 4.82-3ubuntu2.3
eximon4 - 4.82-3ubuntu2.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: exim4 package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.82-3ubuntu2.3').
